page.title: 10EDUCATION IN CAUNTON AREA
page.content: Children aged between 5 and 11 years who live in the area have a choice of schools.Those from the eastern sector may attend Kneesal Primary School whilst those in the north may travel to Norwell Primary School.The majority of children from the grid area live close to and attend the Dean Hole School in Caunton Some parents within the grid opt to send their children to private schools.The choice is usually Wellow House at Wellow. Secondary age children 11-18 yrs fall within the catchment area of three secondary schools,dependant upon the feeder primary school.Children from Kneesal attend the Dukeries Comprehensive at Ollerton,Norwell attend Tuxford Comprehensive and Caunton attend the Minster Comprehensive at Southwell.
